message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper discusses the use of pointer generator networks for abstractive summarization, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a method to address the shortcomings of the pointer generator network, which involves incorporating linguistic information parsed from the input text. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves statistical analysis and human evaluation, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), respectively.
